awd_abstract_narration: An experimental program to investigate the interactions                    between nuclei, the structure of light nuclei and the                           mechanisms of nuclear reactions is proposed.  The program is                    based on two classes of nuclear reactions: elastic scattering                   and knockout reactions.  Recent measurements of Lithium elastic                 scattering data at 210 MeV on a range of targets have provided                  the first unique Lithium-nucleus optical model potentials,                      together with preliminary energy and target-mass dependence.                    Higher energy measurements are proposed to obtain further                       confirmation of the unique potentials, and their energy and                     target-mass dependence.  Proton and alpha induced alpha-                        knockout reactions heavier targets, will permit a systematic                    study of alpha clustering in nuclei across the periodic table.                  The search for heavier clusters by means of knockout reactions                  to complement results of transfer reactions will provide data,                  for theorists to develop improved cluster structure                             calculations.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
